content.webTitle: Savings and debt: We don't like double rate cuts

fields.headline: We don't like ...
fields.bodyText: Building societies are not known for being stingy, but this year there's been a crop of cuts on savings accounts - not once, but twice - despite there being only one base rate cut this year; 0.25% earlier this month. For example Cheshire Building Society dropped the rates on some of its savings accounts by 0.25% in June only to cut them again by 0.25% from next week. Norwich & Peterborough Building Society, which cut savings accounts in March, cut them by 0.4% this week. So just because your savings provider has already cut rates this year, it doesn't mean you will be spared a further reduction.
